    NMdata FAQ

    NMdata-FAQ.Rmd

    Built 2020-09-28 using NMdata 0.0.5.6.

    DISCLAIMER: This vignette is under development.

    I want to use a tool from NMdata, but how can I avoid working with data.table?

    Easy. Every function in NMdata has an argument called fun.as. You can provide a function in this argument which will be applied to data before returnin it.

    NMscanData(..., as.fun = as.data.frame)

    You can also get a tibble if you work with tidyverse tools:

    NMscanData(..., as.fun = tibble::as_tibble)

    If you want to change the behaviour generally for the session and omit the as.fun argument, you can do this by this option:

    options(NMdata.as.fun = tibble::as_tibble)

    And all NMdata functions (that return data) should now return tibbles.
